title: High Urban Slum Population
description: In 2016, 94.2% of South Sudan's urban population lived in slums, indicating significant urban poverty and inadequate housing conditions.

title: Excessive Government Spending
description: In 2022, South Sudan's primary government expenditures were 168% of the original approved budget, reflecting potential fiscal mismanagement.

title: High Rate of Over-age Students
description: As of 2015, 50.2% of male primary students and 48.6% of all primary students were over-age, suggesting challenges in the education system.

title: Significant School Dropout Rates
description: In 2015, 63% of children of primary school age were out of school, highlighting barriers to education access.

title: High Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Secondary Education
description: In 2015, the pupil-teacher ratio in lower secondary schools was 46.7, indicating overcrowded classrooms.

title: Elevated Neonatal Mortality Rate
description: As of 2023, South Sudan had a neonatal mortality rate of 40.2 per 1,000 live births, reflecting healthcare challenges.

title: High Poverty Levels
description: In 2016, 82.3% of the population lived below the national poverty line, indicating widespread economic hardship.

title: Severe Food Insecurity
description: In 2022, 63.2% of the population experienced severe food insecurity, highlighting critical food access issues.

title: High Infant Mortality Rates
description: As of 2023, the infant mortality rate was 72.6 per 1,000 live births, with female and male rates at 66.8 and 78.3, respectively.

title: Youthful Population
description: In 2023, 12.3% of the female and 12.9% of the male population were aged 15-19, indicating a young demographic.

title: Lowest Fertilizer Consumption
description: In 2022, South Sudan had the lowest fertilizer consumption globally, with only 0.0006 kilograms per hectare of arable land.

title: Lowest Access to Electricity
description: As of 2023, only 5.4% of South Sudan's population had access to electricity, making it one of the lowest in the world.

title: Lowest Control of Corruption
description: In 2023, South Sudan scored -1.97 in the Control of Corruption Estimate, indicating a severe corruption issue.

title: Lowest Government Effectiveness
description: With a score of -2.33 in 2023, South Sudan ranks among the lowest in government effectiveness globally.

title: Lowest School Enrollment Rates
description: In 2015, South Sudan's net secondary school enrollment was only 5.48%, one of the lowest globally.

title: Lowest Financial Inclusion
description: In 2021, only 5.83% of South Sudan's population aged 15+ had an account at a financial institution or mobile-money-service provider.

title: Lowest CPIA Ratings
description: South Sudan scored 1 in the CPIA transparency, accountability, and corruption in the public sector rating in 2023, the lowest possible score.

title: Lowest Statistical Performance
description: In 2023, South Sudan's overall statistical performance score was 27.51, indicating significant data challenges.

title: Lowest Energy Imports
description: In 2022, South Sudan had a net energy import value of -859.50% of energy use, indicating a unique energy profile.

title: Lowest Political Stability
description: South Sudan's political stability percentile rank was 0.47 in 2023, reflecting ongoing challenges in maintaining peace.
